content.body: TabAtkins: I think split-filename is only ever used on headings (of varying levels). Might be worth double checking Wattsi, but we don't have to support all the things Wattsi supports of course. Just need rough parity with today's output.
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: I think split-filename is only ever used on headings (of varying levels). Might be worth double checking Wattsi, but we don't have to support all the things Wattsi supports of course. Just need rough parity with today's output.

content.body: Yeah I checked all the splits used by html, it's only headings that I could see

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1pdEefRG6r9fZy61WHGz0TKSt8cO4ISWqlpBN5KntIvQ/edit is some very cool interop work. Person behind https://github.com/ExodusOSS/bytes has been taking a deep dive and doing due diligence on issue filing.
is this the same person as in https://github.com/jsdom/whatwg-encoding/issues/22 ? Ah yeah it is
Good to see Domenic making good use of his retirement there
Jake Archibald: you have to join https://github.com/mozilla-standards for the IPR bot

content.body: Dominic Farolino: btw, I did look at the menu stuff a bit. No super strong opinions on anything (except that it looks useful and looks very much like XUL), but the fieldset stuff is surprising and perhaps also the implicit popover-ness
